issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When there are no available compute nodes requests to the service fail with 503 but also show the stack error

To reproduce stop all compute services 
{code}
euca-modify-service -s STOPPED arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_20/
{code}

Then try something like create keypair.
{code}
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-create-keypair euca-8774-key-5 -U http://10.111.5.20:8773/services/compute
euca-create-keypair: error (503): com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceStateException: Failed to lookup service for compute for path /services/compute.
Current state:
	ServiceConfiguration autoscalingbackend arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscalingbackend:10.111.5.20/ 10.111.5.20:8773:/services/AutoScalingBackend:vm-local:host-local:ENABLED

fields.summary: Super duper service state trace should be removed from console output

comments.body: This message occurs when debug logging is turned on.
[~tony], please confirm the stack trace is only seen in debug mode, not info

This is expected behavior, not a bug. The service states are shown when log level is debug or higher.  The information is not shown when level is set at info.

{code}
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep com
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_183        	STOPPED   	26  	http://10.111.5.183:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_183/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_20         	STOPPED   	26  	http://10.111.5.20:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_20/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_24         	STOPPED   	26  	http://10.111.5.24:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_24/

[root@h-20 ~]# euca-describe-properties cloud.euca_log_level
PROPERTY	cloud.euca_log_level	INFO

[root@h-20 ~]# euca-create-keypair euca-8774-key-5 -U http://10.111.5.20:8773/services/compute
euca-create-keypair: error (503): Service Unavailable
[root@h-20 ~]#
{code}
